title: How to Make Hawaiian Pork Chops

steps.headline: Combine the cinnamon, salt, and nutmeg in a small bowl.
Combine the ketchup, brown sugar, vinegar, and soy sauce in a large bowl.
Season the pork chops on both sides with the nutmeg mixture.
Heat a large skillet on medium-high heat with the butter.
Brown the pork chops for about a minute or two.
steps.description: They will finish cooking in the oven, so you don't need to thoroughly cook them on the stove.

steps.headline: Lay them in a large casserole dish.
steps.description: Add the brown sugar mixture and pineapples on top of the pork chops.

steps.headline: Bake the pork chops for 45 minutes.
steps.description: Finish the dish with a garnish of cherries.

text: Preheat the oven to 350ºF/180ºC.  Combine the cinnamon, salt, and nutmeg in a small bowl.  Combine the ketchup, brown sugar, vinegar, and soy sauce in a large bowl.  Season the pork chops on both sides with the nutmeg mixture.  Heat a large skillet on medium-high heat with the butter.  Brown the pork chops for about a minute or two. They will finish cooking in the oven, so you don't need to thoroughly cook them on the stove. Lay them in a large casserole dish. Add the brown sugar mixture and pineapples on top of the pork chops. Bake the pork chops for 45 minutes. Finish the dish with a garnish of cherries.
